item.title: Root of the tree causing structural damage to the fence, which can fall anytime with high risk of falling on someone. This is a common route for pedestrian. Also, very close to school and i have children living in my house., 13th September
item.description:
This tree has been here over the years, however, I have observed that the root has grown bigger and deeper causing a deep structural damage on my fence (165 Holsten Way, DA18 4DH). I brought in a builder to repair the cracked wall but the structural damage is getting worse due to the fundamental cause being the root of the tree. The tree has to be uprooted urgently so that the cracked wall does not fall on my children or any other person. This is a communal area where pedestrian walk pass all the time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alsike Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mini Sink Hole / Pavement Collapsing, 13th September
item.description:
There appears to be a hole underneath the paving stones, and some of the paving stones have fallen through. There seems to be quite a bit of movement at either end of the drain. Need urgent attention.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rossendale Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Protruding, rocking paving slab caused by tree root, 13th September
item.description:
The tree outside 15 Sandhurst Road, Sidcup, appears to have caused damage to the pavement, including making the paving slab protrude a lot and be completely loose. It is also of note that it is very close to the water meter, so please could you cut the roots to stop any damage to that? It has been like that for some time, but appears to be getting worse, and the pavement is now a considerable trip hazard. Thank you :)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandhurst Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
